1.description: Travels to Wendlyn on a mission from the King of Adarlan, struggling with her identity and magic.

15.description: Begins training with Rowan, learning to control her fire magic and confront her past.

45.description: Fully embraces her Fae heritage and true identity as Aelin Galathynius.

13.description: Ancient Fae warrior and prince, sent by Maeve to train Celaena in magic.

25.description: Reveals his tragic past with his deceased mate Lyria and his centuries of guilt.

45.description: Forms a carranam bond with Aelin, becoming her mate and protector.

7.description: Ironteeth witch and heir to the Blackbeak Clan, chosen as Wing Leader.

22.description: Bonds with the wyvern Abraxos, despite his smaller size and gentle nature.

45.description: Begins to question the orders from the King of Adarlan and her grandmother's plans.

1.description: Captain of the Royal Guard in Rifthold, dealing with the aftermath of recent events.

26.description: Struggles with his feelings for Celaena and his duty to the crown.

1.description: Crown Prince of Adarlan, beginning to manifest magical abilities he must hide.

30.description: His magic grows stronger and more dangerous, putting him at risk from his father.

65.description: Captured by his father and fitted with a Wyrdstone collar to control his magic.

22.description: Smaller wyvern with scarred hide, bonds with Manon despite being considered weak.

35.description: Shows unexpected intelligence and loyalty, proving his worth in battle.

7.description: Elite coven of Ironteeth witches led by Manon Blackbeak.

22.description: Each witch bonds with a wyvern to form the aerial cavalry.

7.description: Manon's Second and cousin, fierce Ironteeth witch and member of the Thirteen.

35.description: Reveals her past and the tragedy that shaped her loyalty to Manon.
35.role: Loyal Second with a tragic past

7.description: Third in command of the Thirteen, practical and strategic witch.
Fourth in the Thirteen, aggressive and hot-tempered witch.
Fifth in the Thirteen, quiet but deadly witch.
Sixth in the Thirteen, steady and reliable witch.
Seventh in the Thirteen, skilled in aerial combat.
Eighth in the Thirteen, fierce in battle.
Ninth in the Thirteen, known for her speed.
Tenth in the Thirteen, tactical and observant.
Eleventh in the Thirteen, strong and dependable.
Twelfth in the Thirteen, youngest member.
Thirteenth in the Thirteen, completes the elite coven.
Ancient and powerful matron of the Blackbeak Clan, grandmother to Manon.

35.description: Ruthlessly ambitious, plotting with the King of Adarlan for power.

13.description: Ancient and powerful Fae Queen who rules from Doranelle, commands Rowan.

25.description: Manipulative and dangerous, has her own agenda regarding Celaena's training.

13.description: Ancient demi-Fae who serves in Mistward, wise and kind healer.

20.description: Reveals his knowledge of Celaena's true identity and heritage.

13.description: Demi-Fae warrior at Mistward, Emrys's companion and protector.
Young demi-Fae at Mistward, eager and enthusiastic about training.

1.description: Tyrannical ruler of Adarlan, using dark magic to expand his empire.

45.description: Revealed to be possessed by the Valg King Erawan, ancient enemy of the Fae.

26.description: The King's advisor and military commander, increasingly powerful.

45.description: Revealed to also be under Valg influence, instrumental in the dark plans.

13.description: Various nobles and courtiers of Wendlyn who interact with Celaena during her mission.

40.description: Valg-possessed general leading the attack on Mistward and demi-Fae.
Celaena's cousin, general in the King's army but secretly loyal to Terrasen.

45.description: Discovers Celaena's true identity, pledges loyalty to his queen.

40.description: Ancient bronze knocker on Elena's tomb, sarcastic and all-knowing.
Spirit of the first Queen of Adarlan, appears to guide Celaena.
Ancient king, Elena's consort, appears as a spirit to aid in the fight against darkness.

55.description: Young woman imprisoned in Morath, daughter of Lady Marion Lochan.

60.description: Helps other prisoners and seeks to escape the horrors of Morath.

55.description: Former court lady now imprisoned and experimented on in Morath.

65.description: Transformed by dark magic, becomes a weapon but retains some humanity.

7.description: Matron of the Yellowlegs Clan, rival to the Blackbeaks.
Matron of the Blueblood Clan, third of the Ironteeth Matrons.

55.description: Elide's uncle, betrayed her family to serve the King of Adarlan.
Elide's mother, died protecting Terrasen loyalists, friend to Queen Evalin.

20.description: Massive flying creatures bred for war, bonded with Ironteeth witches.

7.description: Three great witch clans: Blackbeak, Yellowlegs, and Blueblood.

55.description: Soldiers and guards at the fortress of Morath, many corrupted by Valg influence.

40.description: Human soldiers possessed by Valg demons, losing their humanity.

13.description: Various demi-Fae living at Mistward fortress, descendants of Fae and humans.

20.description: Celaena's deceased mother, former Queen of Terrasen, remembered by those who knew her.
Celaena's deceased father, former King of Terrasen.

45.description: People of Terrasen's capital who await their true queen's return.

40.description: Noble families of Terrasen, some still loyal to the Galathynius line.

1.description: Captains and sailors who transport people across the Narrow Sea.

13.description: Guards and soldiers protecting the Wendlyn royal family and palace.
Various nobles and courtiers at the Wendlyn court who interact with Celaena.
Various Fae warriors serving Queen Maeve, including Rowan's companions.
Demi-Fae and humans who work as servants at Mistward fortress.

55.description: Various people imprisoned in Morath for experiments or punishment.

1.description: Regular soldiers serving in the King of Adarlan's army.
Servants working in the glass castle in Rifthold.
Common people living in Adarlan's capital city of Rifthold.
Various merchants and traders encountered throughout the realm.

25.description: Rowan's deceased mate, killed centuries ago, source of his eternal grief.

13.description: Various ancient Fae who appear in memories and stories told at Mistward.
Ruler of Wendlyn who oversees Celaena's diplomatic mission.
Queen consort of Wendlyn, involved in court politics.
Heir to the Wendlyn throne, present at court during Celaena's visit.
Various noble lords of the Wendlyn court who interact with Celaena.
Noble ladies of the Wendlyn court who observe court politics.
Diplomatic representatives who handle foreign relations for Wendlyn.

40.description: Demonic entities from another realm, possessing humans and causing corruption.
Ancient magical artifacts of immense power, sought by dark forces.

13.description: Demi-Fae guards who protect Mistward fortress from threats.
Demi-Fae who prepare meals and maintain the kitchens at Mistward.
Demi-Fae healers who tend to injuries and illnesses at Mistward.
Demi-Fae scouts who patrol the surrounding lands for threats.
Demi-Fae who train others in combat and survival skills.
Operators of inns and taverns in the port town of Varese.
Merchants and traders operating in the port town of Varese.
Workers who load and unload ships at Varese's busy port.

40.description: Dangerous creatures that can take the form of others, used by Valg forces.
Monstrous creatures inhabiting marshes and swamps, corrupted by dark magic.
Supernatural hunting creatures made of shadow and malice.
High-ranking Valg demons who command lesser forces and possess great power.
Military leaders among the Valg forces, commanding troops and strategies.

7.description: Elder witches of the Blackbeak Clan who advise the Matron.
Warrior witches of the Blackbeak Clan trained for combat.
Warrior witches of the Yellowlegs Clan, rivals to the Blackbeaks.
Elder witches who guide the Yellowlegs Clan and its decisions.
Warrior witches of the Blueblood Clan, part of the Ironteeth alliance.
Elder witches of the Blueblood Clan who provide counsel.

20.description: Specialized workers who care for and train the wyverns used by the witches.
Specialists who breed and raise wyverns for the witch armies.
Experts who train wyverns for combat and riding.

7.description: Skilled metalworkers who create weapons and iron teeth for the witch clans.
Healers among the witch clans who tend to injuries from combat and training.

1.description: Nobles and courtiers serving at the court of the King of Adarlan.
Elite guards who protect the King of Adarlan and the royal family.
Military commanders who lead Adarlan's armies in conquest and war.
Intelligence operatives who gather information for the King of Adarlan.

55.description: Guards who oversee the prisoners and victims at Morath fortress.
Workers who maintain the dark fortress and serve its evil masters.

20.description: Ancient Fae kings mentioned in histories and stories told at Mistward.
Ancient Fae queens whose stories are preserved in Fae lore and history.
Legendary Fae warriors whose deeds are recounted in ancient tales.

13.description: Fae nobles and courtiers who serve in Queen Maeve's court in Doranelle.
Swift Fae who carry messages between Fae territories and courts.
Magical spirits that inhabit the ancient forests around Mistward.
Spirits that dwell in lakes, rivers, and streams near Mistward.
Ancient spirits bound to the earth and mountains of the region.
Professional soldiers serving the Kingdom of Wendlyn.
Sailors who crew Wendlyn's naval vessels and coastal defenses.
Skilled artisans who create goods for the Wendlyn court and kingdom.

40.description: Survivors of Terrasen's fall who remain loyal to the Galathynius line.

25.description: Elemental spirits of fire that respond to Celaena's awakening power.
Spirits of wind and air that aid in magical workings around Mistward.

1.description: Sailors and crew members who work the ships traveling between continents.

13.description: Regular customers and visitors to the taverns and inns of Varese.
Officials who oversee port operations and shipping regulations in Varese.
Small merchants who sell goods in the streets and markets of Varese.
Fishermen who work the coastal waters near Varese.
Workers who care for horses at inns and stables throughout Wendlyn.
Local guards who maintain order in Wendlyn's towns and cities.
Skilled metalworkers who create tools, weapons, and horseshoes.
Workers who clean rooms, serve food, and maintain inns and taverns.
Farmers who work the land around Wendlyn's settlements.
Healers who use plants and herbs to treat ailments and injuries.
Musicians and storytellers who travel between towns sharing news and entertainment.
Religious travelers making pilgrimages to sacred sites in Wendlyn.
Religious leaders who tend to the spiritual needs of local communities.
Merchants who travel with caravans carrying goods between distant cities.
Professional guards hired to protect merchant caravans from bandits.
Skilled navigators who guide boats and barges along Wendlyn's rivers.
Officials who maintain bridges and collect tolls for river crossings.
Keepers who maintain lighthouse beacons to guide ships safely to port.
Individuals skilled in predicting weather patterns for sailors and farmers.
Officials who announce news, proclamations, and important information to the public.
Skilled craftsmen who create maps for travelers, merchants, and officials.
Guards who patrol streets and maintain security during nighttime hours.
Officials who collect taxes and duties for the kingdom's treasury.
Educated individuals who maintain records and correspondence for officials.
Skilled linguists who translate between different languages for diplomats and traders.
Musicians who provide entertainment at court functions and celebrations.
Skilled dancers who perform at court celebrations and ceremonies.
Designers who plan and oversee the construction of important buildings.
Skilled workers who construct buildings, walls, and other structures.
Specialists who maintain palace gardens and landscaping.
Skilled artisans who create jewelry and decorative items for the court.
Expert seamsters who create fine clothing for the royal court.
Craftsmen who make and repair shoes and boots for court members.
Artisans who create perfumes and scented oils for the royal court.
Specialists who produce fine wines for royal consumption and ceremonies.
Skilled bakers who prepare bread and pastries for the royal household.
Kitchen staff who prepare meals for the royal court and guests.
Trained medical professionals who treat illness and injury in the court.
Scholars who maintain the royal library and archives.

recaps.1: Celaena sails to Wendlyn on a mission from the King of Adarlan while Dorian and Chaol remain in Rifthold dealing with the aftermath of recent events.
recaps.2: Celaena arrives in Wendlyn and begins her covert mission while struggling with nightmares and her suppressed magic.
recaps.3: Manon Blackbeak is chosen as Wing Leader of the Ironteeth witches and must prepare for the wyvern selection.
recaps.4: Celaena explores Wendlyn and gathers information while Dorian's magic continues to manifest unpredictably.
recaps.5: The Ironteeth witches prepare for their alliance with the King of Adarlan as Celaena continues her mission.
recaps.6: Celaena struggles with her identity and mission while Chaol investigates strange occurrences in Rifthold.
recaps.7: Manon and the Thirteen arrive at the breeding grounds to select and bond with wyverns for their aerial cavalry.
recaps.8: The witch clans compete and establish hierarchy while Celaena's mission becomes more complex.
recaps.9: Manon faces challenges from other witches while establishing her authority as Wing Leader.
recaps.10: The witches begin the dangerous process of selecting wyverns while Celaena delves deeper into Wendlyn's secrets.
recaps.11: Political tensions rise among the witch clans as they prepare for war.
recaps.12: Celaena's mission takes an unexpected turn while the witches solidify their alliance with Adarlan.
recaps.13: Celaena is taken to Mistward and meets Rowan Whitethorn, an ancient Fae warrior sent to train her.
recaps.14: Rowan begins Celaena's brutal magical training while she resists embracing her Fae heritage.
recaps.15: The training intensifies as Rowan forces Celaena to confront her suppressed fire magic.
recaps.16: Celaena struggles with control over her magic while learning about the demi-Fae at Mistward.
recaps.17: Rowan's harsh training methods push Celaena to her limits as she fights against her true nature.
recaps.18: The training continues with little progress as Celaena remains blocked from accessing her full power.
recaps.19: Frustrations mount between Celaena and Rowan as her magical training yields minimal results.
recaps.20: Emrys reveals knowledge about Celaena's true identity and her royal Terrasen heritage.
recaps.21: Celaena learns more about her past and the tragedy that befell her family and kingdom.
recaps.22: Manon bonds with Abraxos, a smaller wyvern, despite pressure to choose a larger, more aggressive mount.
recaps.23: The witch-wyvern bonds solidify as they prepare for their first flights and combat training.
recaps.24: Manon's relationship with Abraxos deepens while other witches complete their bonding process.
recaps.25: Rowan reveals his tragic past with his deceased mate Lyria, sharing his centuries of grief with Celaena.
recaps.26: The emotional connection between Celaena and Rowan grows as they share their painful histories.
recaps.27: Celaena begins to make breakthrough progress in her magical training under Rowan's guidance.
recaps.28: The training relationship evolves as Celaena starts to trust Rowan and embrace her abilities.
recaps.29: Political developments in Wendlyn affect Celaena's mission while her magic grows stronger.
recaps.30: Celaena's magical abilities advance significantly as she learns to work with rather than against her power. Dorian's magic becomes increasingly dangerous and difficult to hide.
recaps.31: The Ironteeth witches begin advanced flight training with their wyverns, preparing for aerial combat.
recaps.32: Manon's leadership is tested as she guides the Thirteen through dangerous training exercises.
recaps.33: The witch covens face internal politics and rivalry while preparing for their role in the coming war.
recaps.34: Flight formations and combat maneuvers are practiced as the aerial cavalry takes shape.
recaps.35: Grandmother Blackbeak reveals more of her ruthless plans while Celaena's identity crisis deepens.
recaps.36: The witch matrons solidify their agreement with the King of Adarlan's forces.
recaps.37: Training intensifies for both witches and wyverns as they prepare for deployment.
recaps.38: Manon faces challenges to her authority while maintaining control over the Thirteen.
recaps.39: The aerial cavalry demonstrates their capabilities in preparation for war deployment.
recaps.40: Valg-possessed forces led by General Narrok attack Mistward, forcing Celaena and Rowan to defend the fortress. Elena's spirit appears to guide Celaena toward her destiny.
recaps.41: The battle at Mistward intensifies as Valg creatures and possessed soldiers assault the fortress.
recaps.42: Celaena and Rowan fight together against the Valg threat while protecting the demi-Fae.
recaps.43: The true nature of the King of Adarlan's forces is revealed as the Valg influence becomes clear.
recaps.44: Celaena begins to access more of her fire magic during the desperate battle.
recaps.45: Celaena fully embraces her identity as Aelin Galathynius and her role as Queen of Terrasen. She and Rowan form a carranam bond.
recaps.46: Aelin and Rowan work together to defeat the Valg forces threatening Mistward.
recaps.47: The aftermath of the battle reveals the extent of the Valg threat and Erawan's influence.
recaps.48: Aelin begins to plan her return to claim her throne while Rowan pledges his loyalty.
recaps.49: Preparations are made for Aelin's eventual return to Terrasen to reclaim her kingdom.
recaps.50: Political maneuvering continues as various forces prepare for the larger conflict ahead. Aedion's true loyalties are tested.
recaps.51: The witches complete their training and prepare for deployment to support Adarlan's forces.
recaps.52: Manon leads the Thirteen in final preparations as they await orders for their first mission.
recaps.53: The aerial cavalry is deemed ready for combat as tensions escalate across the kingdoms.
recaps.54: Final preparations are made as various factions position themselves for the coming conflict.
recaps.55: Elide Lochan is revealed as a prisoner in Morath, where Duke Perrington conducts dark experiments. Kaltain also suffers in the dungeons.
recaps.56: The horrors of Morath are revealed as prisoners endure Valg experimentation and torture.
recaps.57: Elide discovers the true extent of the evil being perpetrated at the fortress.
recaps.58: The prisoners at Morath attempt to resist and survive the ongoing experiments.
recaps.59: Kaltain's transformation continues as she becomes a weapon for Duke Perrington.
recaps.60: Elide forms alliances with other prisoners while seeking a way to escape Morath. Dorian's situation worsens.
recaps.61: The situation in Morath deteriorates as more people are brought in for experimentation.
recaps.62: Duke Perrington's plans advance as he prepares his Valg army for deployment.
recaps.63: The prisoners face increasingly desperate circumstances as escape seems impossible.
recaps.64: Valg forces mobilize from Morath as Erawan's plans reach a critical phase.
recaps.65: Dorian is captured and fitted with a Wyrdstone collar, becoming a prisoner of his own father. Kaltain's transformation reaches completion.
recaps.66: The full extent of Erawan's control over the Kingdom of Adarlan becomes apparent.
recaps.67: Multiple storylines converge as the various characters face their greatest challenges.
recaps.68: The book concludes with Aelin preparing to return to Terrasen while dark forces marshal for war across the continent.
